intro: Bignonia brachypoda, commonly known as the yellow morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a climbing vine characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Bignonia brachypoda thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along streambanks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
